author: Vivian Velasquez-Caldera
title: I work at a coronavirus drive-thru testing site in New York. Here's what a 12-hour shift looks like
description: My husband wasn't too happy about my decision to volunteer at a coronavirus drive-thru testing center in New York. It's a risky job. I stand on my feet for hours on end. The days are emotional and crazy. Everyone is scared. But someone has to do it.
content:
As a phlebotomist at Northwell Health, a New York-based non-profit healthcare provider, my job is to draw blood from people, ensuring that the right amount is taken and that everything is properly labeled.
Like everyone else in this field, I'm comfortable ar… [+5749 chars]
